title: How to Do a Monotype Challenge on Pokémon

steps.headline: Choose a Pokémon type.
steps.description: E.g. Poison, Flying, Water, Ground... any type is acceptable, but some types may be more difficult than others due to rarity and so on).

steps.headline: If the type you have chosen is not available at the beginning stage of the game, there are ways around this.
steps.description: For example the Dragon type does not make an appearance in most games until very late on. If this is the case, you can either trade the required Pokémon from a friend's game or use Gameshark codes to insert them.

steps.headline: The aim of this challenge is to keep to one type throughout the entire game.
steps.description: Essentially, you will be experiencing the Pokémon world as though you were a budding Gym Leader!

text: Start the game as normal. Choose your starting Pokémon. Choose a Pokémon type. E.g. Poison, Flying, Water, Ground... any type is acceptable, but some types may be more difficult than others due to rarity and so on). If the type you have chosen is not available at the beginning stage of the game, there are ways around this. For example the Dragon type does not make an appearance in most games until very late on. If this is the case, you can either trade the required Pokémon from a friend's game or use Gameshark codes to insert them. The aim of this challenge is to keep to one type throughout the entire game. Essentially, you will be experiencing the Pokémon world as though you were a budding Gym Leader!
